thread.title: Dodgers organist Nancy Bea Hefley to retire after season
thread.title_full: Dodgers organist Nancy Bea Hefley to retire after season

title: Dodgers organist Nancy Bea Hefley to retire after season
text:
Dodgers organist Nancy Bea Hefley to retire after season Posted: By BETH HARRISAP Sports Writer 
LOS ANGELES (AP) - Nancy Bea Hefley, whose organ has provided the musical backdrop to the action on the field for the Los Angeles Dodgers, is retiring at season's end. 
Hefley announced her decision Friday night before the three-time NL West champions hosted San Diego. The 79-year-old organist has been playing at Dodger Stadium for 28 years. 
Hefley took over from Helen Dell in 1988 and has become as much a fan favorite as Hall of Fame broadcaster Vin Scully and retired manager Tom Lasorda. She began playing the piano at age 4 and at 13 she talked her teacher into showing her the basics of the organ. 
Hefley commutes to each homestand from her home in Silver Springs, Nevada, while renting a second home locally. She is accompanied by her husband, Bill, whom she met while playing the organ at church. Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.   This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
